summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), particularly resolutions 1484 (2003) and 1493 (2003),
Reaffirming commitment to DRC's sovereignty, territorial integrity, and political independence,
Deeply concerned by ongoing hostilities in eastern DRC, particularly in Ituri, North and South Kivu,
Reaffirming support to the peace process, national reconciliation, and the United Nations Organization Mission in the DRC (MONUC),
Supports the Interim Emergency Multinational Force deployed in Bunia under resolution 1484 (2003), stressing the need for smooth transfer of authority to MONUC by 1 September 2003,
Noting the situation in DRC remains a threat to international peace and security,
Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter,
 Approves the Secretary-General's recommendation of 14 August 2003;
 Authorizes States members of the Interim Emergency Multinational Force to assist MONUC in Bunia and its surroundings, if requested, during the disengagement period until 15 September 2003;
Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
